Posts.Content: Thanks Leolady for your reply, I did read your interesting  profile. it may be that I dodged a bullet, not getting chemo/Herceptin, time will tell. The oncologist just referred me to Predict Tool, only a 3% uplift with Chemo and said for me risks outweighed benefits. The BC nurse said 'lobular doesn't respond as well to chemo' which I think is somewhat simplistic. To be honest IF I had been offered Chemo/Herceptin I would not have hesitated, for fear of reoccurrence. Interesting what you say about 'no longer beating yourself up...' You have hit the nail on the head, I am beating myself up for not pursuing a second opinion re chemo and imaging every twinge to be reoccurrence. Plus a fair amount of anger of being denied chemo. Nuts isn't it, all those ladies braving dangerous and unpleasant SE's on the chemo threads, here I am dwelling on 'imagined consequences of under treatment'.  Best wishes
Posts.Title: Lobular breast cancer, ER and Her2 Pos

Posts.Content: Dear Jac, Thanks for your reply, especially glad to hear all good with your one year check, such a relief for you and your family I did raise my fears of being denied chemo during my radiotherapy , I saw an absolutely lovely GP (doing sessions in RT, checking all ok) I voiced my concerns, asked her to write it in my notes, she listened and said to me 'but your cancer has been removed,'  Then at the end of RT I had an appt with the oncologist. This was not a good consult, his body language was almost of losing patience with me and trotting out of the Predict Tool again. I have become obsessive with reading scientific papers on lobular BC, not many are ER and HER 2 Pos. I did find one presentation at the 2018 San Antonio Conference, the conclusion being - 'there is a small sub group of Her 2 Pos, ER pos, lobular BC that may not benefit from chemo/targeted therapy' I tell myself I am in that group, I will be having my one year check in May/June, I hope to see my surgeon who was brilliant. The other pertinent fact in my case is that Her2 Pos are not offered Oncotype test, it is not validated for Her 2 Pos and not relevant. Oncotype is another useful tool for oncologists to use when considering adjacent treatment. As you can see I talk myself in and out of positive/negative thoughts. I need to stop reading and get out more! Thanks for listening it helps! Best wishes
